HowToPlay.title: How to Play
HowToPlay.subtitle: Card Golf — Quick Rules
HowToPlay.goalBody: Get the lowest score. After all rounds, the player with the fewest total points wins.
HowToPlay.setupBody: Each player gets 6 cards in a 2×3 grid, all face down. Before play begins, each player flips 2 of their own cards face up.
HowToPlay.turnIntro: On your turn, choose one of three actions:
HowToPlay.drawBody: Pick up the top card, then either swap it with a card in your hand or discard it.
HowToPlay.takeBody: Take the top card from the discard pile and swap it with any card in your hand.
HowToPlay.flipBody: Flip any face-down card in your hand face up. This uses your whole turn.
HowToPlay.matchBody: If both cards in the same column share the same rank, the entire column scores 0. Build matches to eliminate points!
HowToPlay.setupBody9: Each player gets 9 cards in a 3×3 grid, all face down. Before play begins, each player flips 2 cards face up.
HowToPlay.setupGridLabel9: Start of round — 2 cards revealed (9-card grid)
HowToPlay.matchBody9: Any column, row, or diagonal where all 3 cards share the same rank scores 0. Three ways to eliminate points!
HowToPlay.squareBody: If 4 cards of the same rank form a 2×2 block, the whole group scores −(face value) total — not per card. Four 6s together score −6. Four Aces score −1. King and 2 are excluded.
HowToPlay.valuesOther: All other cards score their face value (3 = 3 pts, 9 = 9 pts, etc.)
HowToPlay.endBody: When a player flips their last face-down card, every other player gets one final turn. Then all cards are revealed and the round is scored.
HowToPlay.winBody: After all rounds, the player with the lowest total score wins. Equal scores result in a draw.
HowToPlay.powerCardsIntro: When a power card is drawn, you may use its special ability instead of placing it normally:
HowToPlay.jackBody: Secretly peek at any one of your own face-down cards. Only you see it.
HowToPlay.queenBody: Secretly peek at any one of your opponent's face-down cards.
HowToPlay.kingBody: Swap any card in your hand with any card in your opponent's hand.
HowToPlay.jokerAbilityBody: Swap two of your opponent's card positions. Great for breaking up their matches.
HowToPlay.powerCardsNote: You can always choose to place the card normally or discard it instead of using the ability.
HowToPlay.jokersIntro: Two Jokers are added to the deck. Jokers never match in lines or squares — they use their own scoring:
HowToPlay.jokerPairBody: If two Jokers are in your hand, they pair together and score as one group instead of individually.
